meanings.definition: A person who sets up or arranges film equipment on a set.
meanings.sent1: The filmsetters worked tirelessly to prepare the cameras and lights for the movie shoot.
meanings.sent2: During the film production, the filmsetters ensured all the equipment was in place for filming.
meanings.sent3: The filmsetters joked that setting up the film equipment was like solving a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: In the world of filmmaking, the filmsetters are the unsung heroes behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: The filmsetters' precision and attention to detail transformed the empty set into a cinematic masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of setting up or arranging film equipment on a set.
meanings.sent1: The filmsetters' job involves organizing and placing all the necessary film equipment.
meanings.sent2: Filmsetters play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of the film set.
meanings.sent3: As the director yelled 'Action!', the filmsetters quickly adjusted the lighting.
meanings.sent4: The filmsetters' coordination and efficiency keep the filming process on track.
meanings.sent5: Every successful film production relies on the expertise of skilled filmsetters.
